description: From Turkish molla, Persian ملا‎ (mollâ), from Arabic مَوْلًى‎ (mawlan, “vicar, guardian”).

entries.meaning: (Islam) A religious scholar and teacher of sharia law.
(India, religious slur, slang) A conservative Muslim leader or cleric, especially one who is hostile against other religions.
(India, religious slur, slang, by extension) A Muslim.

verbs.description: mullah (third-person singular simple present mullahs, present participle mullahing, simple past and past participle mullahed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK, slang) Alternative form of muller (“to beat, thrash”)
examples: The Sevens practice session was touch rugby, but every time Harvey got the ball, I absolutely mullahed him. I pushed him, dumped him on his arse, ran through him. Every time.
